ui <- fluidPage(

  # App title ----
  titlePanel("CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLES"),

  # Sidebar layout with input and output definitions ----
  sidebarLayout(

    # Sidebar panel for inputs ----

        list("CONSUMO","IMPORTACION"),
        selected = NULL,
        multiple = FALSE,
        selectize = TRUE,
        width = NULL,
        size = NULL
        ),
        selectInput(
        inputId="DataSlicesShown",
        label="Mostrar:",
        list("TENDENCIA, ESTACIONALIDAD, RUIDO"),
        selected = TRUE,
        multiple = TRUE,
        selectize = TRUE,
        width = NULL,
        size = NULL
        ),
      dateRangeInput(
  inputId = "DDR",
  label = "Date Range",
  start = "2000-1-1",
  end = "2020-1-1",
  min = "2000-1-1",
  max = "2020-1-1",
  format = "yyyy-mm-dd",
  startview = "month",
  weekstart = 0,
  language = "en",
  separator = " to ",
  width = NULL,
  autoclose = TRUE
)
      
      
      
      ),
    

    # Main panel for displaying outputs ----
    mainPanel(

      # Output: Histogram ----
      plotOutput(outputId = "distPlot"),
      plotOutput(outputId = "SamplePlot")

    )
  )
)

server <- function(input, output) {

  # Histogram of the Old Faithful Geyser Data ----
  # with requested number of bins
  # This expression that generates a histogram is wrapped in a call
  # to renderPlot to indicate that:
  #
  # 1. It is "reactive" and therefore should be automatically
  #    re-executed when inputs (input$bins) change
  # 2. Its output type is a plot
  output$distPlot <- renderPlot({

    x    <- faithful$waiting
    bins <- seq(min(x), max(x), length.out = input$bans + 1)

    hist(x, breaks = bins, col = "#75AADB", border = "white",
         xlab = "Waiting time to next eruption (in mins)",
         main = "Histogram of waiting times")

    })
  output$SamplePlot <- renderPlot({
    


    min <- c(year(input$DDR[1]), month(input$DDR[1]))
    max <- c(year(input$DDR[2]), month(input$DDR[2]))

    rango$Date <- window(dec_cons_Diesel$Date, min, max)
    rango$trend <- window(dec_cons_Diesel$trend, min, max)
    rango$seasonal <- window(dec_cons_Diesel$seasonal, min, max)
    rango$random <- window(dec_cons_Diesel$random, min, max)

            plot(rango$Date, rango$trend + rango$seasonal + rango$random,  
         main="BRUH", ylab = "Barriles", xlab="Fecha", type="l")
  })
  


}

shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
runApp("my_app")

## MODELOS DIESEL
auto.arima(Consumo_Diesel)

fit_consumo_diesel <- arima(log(Consumo_Diesel), c(3, 0, 1),seasonal = list(order = c(1, 1, 2), period = 12))
forecastAP_Consumo_Diesel <- forecast(fit_consumo_diesel, level = c(95), h = 3*12)
autoplot(forecastAP_Consumo_Diesel)

pred <- predict(fit_consumo_diesel, n.ahead = 3*12)
ts.plot(Consumo_Diesel,2.756^pred$pred, log = "y", lty = c(1,3))




auto.arima(importacion_Diesel)

fit_importacion_diesel <- arima(log(importacion_Diesel), c(3, 1, 1),seasonal = list(order = c(1, 1, 2), period = 12))
forecastAP_Importacion_Diesel <- forecast(fit_importacion_diesel, level = c(95), h = 3*12)
autoplot(forecastAP_Importacion_Diesel)

pred <- predict(fit_importacion_diesel, n.ahead = 3*12)
ts.plot(importacion_Diesel,2.756^pred$pred, log = "y", lty = c(1,3))
